private_information: I can perform actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with a set of objects object_0..object_8.
Action preconditions and effects are defined informally: paltry requires hand obj0 cats obj1 texture obj2 vase obj0 obj1 next obj1 obj2; paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and vase obj0 obj1 false.
sip requires hand obj0 cats obj1 texture obj2 next obj0 obj2 next obj1 obj2; sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and next obj0 obj2 false.
clip requires hand obj0 sneeze obj1 texture obj2 next obj1 obj2 next obj0 obj2; clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and next obj0 obj2 false.
wretched requires sneeze obj0 texture obj1 texture obj2 stupendous obj3 next obj0 obj1 collect obj1 obj3 collect obj2 obj3; wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and next obj0 obj1 false.
memory requires cats obj0 spring obj1 spring obj2 next obj0 obj1; memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and next obj0 obj1 false.
tightfisted requires hand obj0 sneeze obj1 texture obj2 next obj1 obj2 vase obj0 obj1; tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and vase obj0 obj1 false.

Example initial statement A: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_3, hand object_8, next object_0 object_7, next object_1 object_7, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_7, next object_8 object_7, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_7, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7. Goal: next object_8 object_6. Example plan: sip object_8 object_1 object_7; memory object_1 object_7 object_6; paltry object_8 object_1 object_6.

Example initial statement B: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_2, hand object_7, hand object_8, next object_0 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_6, next object_7 object_6, next object_8 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_6, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6. Goal: next object_7 object_6 and next object_8 object_6.
player.goal: Given an initial fact set, propose a concrete sequential plan of the domain actions to reach the stated next relations. Provide an ordered action list and annotate any assumptions made about object name mappings or missing facts.

private_information: My role is to audit temporal and causal consistency and to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or ad hoc post-hoc penalties.
I check that action preconditions are satisfied at the time of their execution, that effects do not conflict, and that any shorthand facts are expanded to explicit facts.
I will produce a list of detected inconsistencies, required auxiliary facts, and recommended corrections to make plans executable without bookkeeping shortcuts.
auditor.goal: Validate and repair proposed plans and normalized facts so they are temporally and causally sound and free of bookkeeping shortcuts.

private_information: My role is to normalize freeform initial statements and plans into a compact machine-friendly fact list and action sequence.
I map informal predicates to canonical predicate names such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous and produce a single list of objects present.
I will also expand implicit ranges and produce consistent object identifiers object_0..object_8 as needed.
summarizer.goal: Produce normalized facts and an explicit sequential plan representation that other agents can consume.

private_information: I coordinate inputs from player, auditor, and summarizer and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
I must keep agent actions distinct if needed and ensure the final PDDL encodes preconditions and effects faithfully and unambiguously.
I should integrate the auditor corrections and the summarizer normalized facts before generating the PDDL.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem pair targeted for FastDownwards that encodes the action schemas, initial facts, and goals, and is consistent with auditor corrections. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.

public_information: Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action has specified preconditions and effects over predicates hand, cats, texture, vase, next, collect, sneeze, spring, stupendous.
Predicates are binary relations of the form predicate object_X object_Y or unary forms represented as predicate object_X when applicable.
Goals are expressed as next relations such as next object_8 object_6 that must hold in the final state.
Planning must respect causal ordering and cannot rely on bookkeeping shortcuts or informal tokens.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the domain player who knows the informal action schemas and example initial statements and plans. You should produce a detailed stepwise proposed action sequence for each given initial statement and annotate any missing facts or naming ambiguities. Do not emit PDDL. Provide facts and the ordered plan in a machine-friendly list format.

normalize.system_prompt: You are the normalizer. Take freeform initial statements and plans and convert them into canonical facts and an explicit ordered action list using the canonical object names object_0..object_8 and canonical predicate names. Do not emit PDDL. Output a JSON-like facts list and an ordered plan representation.

audit.system_prompt: You are the temporal and causal auditor. Analyze the normalized facts and the proposed plan for temporal and causal consistency. Identify missing preconditions, conflicting effects, and any bookkeeping shortcuts. Recommend explicit repairs and auxiliary facts required to make the plan executable. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL generation for FastDownwards. Integrate the normalized facts, the auditor corrections, and the player's proposed plan. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct where necessary and ensure types, predicates, and objects are declared. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. The resulting PDDL must be syntactically valid and include :requirements appropriate for FastDownwards, an objects section listing object_0..object_8, an initial state encoding the normalized and auditor-corrected facts, and the goal state. If you must add auxiliary predicates for correctness, define them explicitly.
